page.title: 18MR LAYZELL'S LIFE. PART 1.
page.content: I was born in Branscombe in 1897 at Cotte Cottages which have now been knocked down. I went to school at Branscombe, and was 14 years old when I left. The school has altered a great deal since I went there, when I was there,there was 120 children in the school. I enjoyed working in the forge, there was mainly farm horses to shoe, and a few donkeys.I could shoe about six Heavy Cart Horses a day this is taking into account that all horse shoes were then hand made, the amount of iron used for each shoe on a Cart Horse was 43cm by 3cm wide and 1cm thick, on the back they were about 1 and a half thick.The cost for a set of horse shoes was 2/6d or twelve and a half pence, and five pence for a set of Donkey shoes.
